subanswer.text: With $100, Adam could purchase an equal share price divided by cost per unit which equals floor(100/5) = 20 units or items (since you cannot purchase fractions of these). In our case here would be equivalent to calculating 'floor'. This ensures no partial item remains unsold due to fractional value being nonviable since physical goods such as stones may not even exist if bought partially! Hence now lets go ahead towards finding out what percentage gets sold . Here goes :   -> Total possible sales when completely filled up [price x quantity] => Price*Quantity=Sales_Achieved=> 20*$2504841=$50096820 Thus having spent altogether RM 50096820; And losing back again from one side... Let us proceed next :-D   --> Lost Amount=[Total Money Spent-(Amount Earned)]=(RM 100)-($50096820)=-$50096710 ; i believe its just some typos making everyone confused :) hence let me try once more..:-P    Thereby , Losses Due To Unsuccessful Sales:=[Investment Made -(Percentage Sold Out Of Whole Stock)*Price Per Unit]*NumberOfItems Purchased     :=[$100 - ($2504841*(0.6))]*20      ================================->>> We get Our Answer As=-$1402908 !!!
